answer:
<p>I think the best way to solve this problem is to use a lambda function.</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *
admin= Tk()
<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">button</span>(<span class="hljs-params">an</span>):
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(an)
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"het"</span>)
b = Button(admin, text=<span class="hljs-string">"as"</span>, command=<span class="hljs-keyword">lambda</span>: button(<span class="hljs-string">"hey"</span>))
b.pack()
mainloop()
</code></pre>
<p>If you don't want to use the command keyword, you can use the .bind() method instead:</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span> tkinter <span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> *
admin= Tk()
<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">button</span>(<span class="hljs-params">an</span>):
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(an)
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"het"</span>)
b = Button(admin, text=<span class="hljs-string">"as"</span>)
b.pack()
b.bind(<span class="hljs-string">"&lt;Button-1&gt;"</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">lambda</span> bb: button(<span class="hljs-string">"hey"</span>))
mainloop()
</code></pre>
<p>Using a mother function (no parameter) which owns the child function (at least 1 parameter) you want to call is stupid.</p>
<p>Just to share with you, this is one of my program:</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span> tkinter
window = tkinter.Tk()

<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">plus_them</span>(<span class="hljs-params">field_1, field_2, field_3</span>):
    field_3.delete(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'end'</span>)
    num1 = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>
    num2 = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">try</span>:
        num1 = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(field_1.get())
        num2 = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(field_2.get())
    <span class="hljs-keyword">except</span>:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Exception occurs"</span>)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Continue"</span>)
    result = num1 + num2
    field_3.insert(tkinter.END, <span class="hljs-built_in">str</span>(result))
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> result
<span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">minus_them</span>(<span class="hljs-params">field_1, field_2, field_3</span>):
    field_3.delete(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'end'</span>)
    num1 = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>
    num2 = <span class="hljs-number">0</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">try</span>:
        num1 = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(field_1.get())
        num2 = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(field_2.get())
    <span class="hljs-keyword">except</span>:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Exception occurs"</span>)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Continue"</span>)
    result = num1 - num2
    field_3.insert(tkinter.END, <span class="hljs-built_in">str</span>(result))
    <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> result

<span class="hljs-comment">#Input Panel:</span>
label_1 = tkinter.Label(window, text=<span class="hljs-string">"First Number:"</span>)
label_1.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
label_2 = tkinter.Label(window, text=<span class="hljs-string">"Second Number:"</span>)
label_2.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
entry_1 = tkinter.Entry(window)
entry_1.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)
entry_2 = tkinter.Entry(window)
entry_2.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)

<span class="hljs-comment">#Button Panel:</span>
button_1 = tkinter.Button(window, text=<span class="hljs-string">"Plus"</span>)
button_1.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
button_2 = tkinter.Button(window, text=<span class="hljs-string">"Minus"</span>)
button_2.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)

<span class="hljs-comment">#Answer Panel:</span>
label_3 = tkinter.Label(window, text=<span class="hljs-string">"The Answer:"</span>)
label_3.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">0</span>)
entry_3 = tkinter.Entry(window)
entry_3.grid(row=<span class="hljs-number">3</span>, column=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>)

<span class="hljs-comment">#Event Handling:</span>
button_1.bind(<span class="hljs-string">"&lt;Button-1&gt;"</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">lambda</span> p: plus_them(entry_1, entry_2, entry_3))
button_2.bind(<span class="hljs-string">"&lt;Button-1&gt;"</span>, <span class="hljs-keyword">lambda</span> m: minus_them(entry_1, entry_2, entry_3))

<span class="hljs-comment">#Window Stuff:</span>
window.title(<span class="hljs-string">"Plus and Minus Calculator"</span>)
window.mainloop()
</code></pre>
<p>That's it.</p>
